definition: (Osama) bin Laden (1957-2011), leader of Al Qaeda
to pull/to play (a bowed instrument)/to drag/to draw/to chat

to scale (a height)/to ascend/to mount/to publish or record/to enter (e.g. in a register)/to press down with the foot/to step or tread on/to put on (shoes or trousers) (dialect)/to be gathered and taken to the threshing ground (old)
(Osama) bin Laden (1957-2011), leader of Al Qaeda
Osama bin Laden (1957-2011), leader of Al Qaeda

sentences.english: Bin Laden daughter hides in Saudi embassy in Iran.
sentences.chinese: 拉登女兒擺脫伊朗軟禁，躲入沙特大使館。

sentences.english: Three years ago this month Usama bin Laden masterminded the assault on the World Trade Towers in New York.
sentences.chinese: 三年前的這個月，拉登策劃了對紐約世貿大廈的襲擊。

sentences.english: Osama bin Laden was killed, not captured.
sentences.chinese: 奧薩馬本拉登被擊斃而非被捕。

sentences.english: Can the Pakistani government's web of deceit survive the death of Osama bin Laden?
sentences.chinese: 巴基斯坦政府的謊言之網能讓拉登起死回生嗎？

sentences.english: Did bin Laden go to sleep every night thinking The next night they’re coming?
sentences.chinese: 本拉登每晚睡覺的時候都會想‘明晚他們會來嗎？’

sentences.english: The death of Mr. bin Laden is a defining moment in the American-led war on terrorism.
sentences.chinese: 本拉登之死是美國領導的反恐戰爭的決定性的時刻。

sentences.english: Al-Sadah became bin Laden's fifth wife.
sentences.chinese: 鋁Sadah成爲拉登的第五任妻子。

sentences.english: Bin Laden has also been charged for conspiring to kill Americans outside the U.S.
sentences.chinese: 拉登還被指控涉嫌謀殺境外的美國公民。

sentences.english: Officials have said no one fired on the US navy Seals in Bin Laden's house.
sentences.chinese: 官方卻說海豹突襲隊抵達拉登住宅時沒有人東火。

sentences.english: This one above shows two Lego commandos confront Bin Laden.
sentences.chinese: 而上圖則展示了兩個士兵持槍與拉登對峙。

sentences.english: And Zakir might do well to remember what happened to Osama bin Laden.
sentences.chinese: 賈基爾最好銘記發生在奧薩馬本拉登身上的一切。

sentences.english: Osama bin Laden was killed with two shots, one of them hitting above his left eye.
sentences.chinese: 拉登中兩槍斃命，其中一槍擊中他的左眼上方。

sentences.english: All those questions faded into irrelevance with bin Laden's death on Sunday.
sentences.chinese: 所有這些因爲本週日本拉登的死亡而不再成爲問題。

sentences.english: Decentralising was always an integral part of the strategy of bin Laden.
sentences.chinese: 去中心化一直都是本拉登戰略的一部分。

sentences.english: Bin Laden never co-operated with Iran but he cooperated with Mr. Bush," Ahmadinejad said.
sentences.chinese: 拉登從來沒有同伊朗合作過，但跟布什合作過。

sentences.english: They shot and killed him, as well as wounding a woman with him.
sentences.chinese: 他們擊斃了他，也打傷了一爲陪同本拉登的女性。
